oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Local piezoelectric response of ZnO nanoparticles embedded in a photosensitive polymer
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PRASHANTHI, K
ZHANG, H
RAO, VR
THUNDAT, T
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: nanocomposites
piezoelectric properties
epoxy
polymers
ZnO
FILLED POLYMERS
THIN-FILMS
ARRAYS
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Local piezoelectric properties of ZnO nanoparticles (NPs) embedded in a photo-epoxy polymer are investigated by piezoresponse force microscopy (PFM). Integrating ZnO NPs into a photosensitive SU-8 polymer matrix not only retains the highly desired piezoelectric properties of the ZnO, but also preserves photosensitivity and optical transparency of the SU-8 polymer. These results have strong implications for simple photolithography based low-cost fabrication of piezoelectric microelectromechanicalsystems (MEMS) and nano-electromechanicalsystems (NEMS) in both sensing and energy harvesting applications.
